page.title: 13THE OLD COURSE HOTEL
page.content: The Old Course Hotel was built by British Rail in 1968 and was relatively small, with 80 bedrooms, 2 bars and 2 restaurants. In 1982 it was bought by Frank Sheridan. He redeveloped the hotel for leisure purposes, increasing the number of rooms to 150 and enlarging the restaurants and bars. Now there is an indoor swimming pool, solarium, jacuzzi, sauna and an exercise room. There is an indoor golf school and 2 shops. In summer there aee 160 staff and 30 chefs but there are less than 40 staff in winter.
